properties.areaDesc: Guadalupe Mountains Above 7000 Feet; Guadalupe and Delaware Mountains
properties.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 5 at 2:54AM CST until February 5 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Midland/Odessa TX
properties.description:
* WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations
of 3 to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. A Blizzard
Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or
occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor
visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout
conditions, making travel extremely dangerous. Do not travel.
If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If
you get stranded, stay with your vehicle.

* WHERE...Guadalupe and Delaware Mountains in Texas.

* WHEN...Until 5 PM MST this afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty
winds could bring down tree branches. The cold wind chills as
low as 5 below zero could result in hypothermia if precautions
are not taken.
properties.instruction:
Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must
travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded,
stay with your vehicle.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 800-452-
9292.

NWSheadline: BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON
